meeting_annotations.speaker: Katherine Hornbostel
meeting_annotations.transcript: And during normal operation you would

meeting_annotations.speaker: Katherine Hornbostel
meeting_annotations.transcript: send your power to the grid and maybe do carbon capture of the exhaust. Um but in the future when there's a ton of renewable power out there, there's going to be big spikes where there's like tons of wind or solar on the grid and then you have to kind of shut down all of your, you know, or a lot of your natural gas. So the thought is mode two would happen when there's tons of power, there's a surplus on the grid and you need to either shut down or use it for something else. So you could possibly use your own electricity in house to power a DAC system. Um so you're sending your electricity now to your own DAC system and you're also using compressed air off of the natural gas compressor possibly um to go to your DAC system, which is great because it's like 15 or 20 times the pressure of, you know, regular air, so you have higher partial pressures of CO2, so you can get much better performance from DAC. Um so that's the idea. There there's other concepts out there. They're proposing similarish things, but something like this where you can kind of oscillate between two modes and do some direct air capture. Um and the thought is that you could go negative emissions over the lifespan of this plant possibly if you have enough mode two going on.
